title: ISic000627. I.Sicily inscription 000627
body:
1T(ito) · Fulvio · Aurelio
2Antonino
3Imp(eratoris) · Caes(aris) · M(arci) · Aureli · Antonini
4Aug(usti) · filio
5L(ucius) · Aponius · Rufinus
6ob honorem · seviratus ·
7 pec(unia) · sua ·

l.1 reg., orig. FULVIOFulvio

1T·FULVIO·AURELIO
2ANTONINO
3IMP·CAES·M·AURELI·ANTONINI
4AUG·FILIO
5L·APONIUS·RUFINUS
6OBHONOREM·SEVIRATUS·
7PEC·SUA·

l.1 reg., orig. FULVIOFulvio

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text controlled against photographs and drawing of Salinas;
  • line.3: The final I is not clearly visible in either published photograph, but is recorded in the drawing of Salinas; autopsy is required

translation

Jonathan Prag

To Titus Fulvius (Fulvus) Aurelius Antoninus, son of Imperator Caesar Marcus Aurelius Antoninus Augustus. Lucius Aponius Rufinus (set this up) to mark the honour of his holding of the sevirate, at his own expense.

commentary

Titus Aurelius Fulvus Antoninus was the short-lived twin brother of the emperor Commodus, son of the emperor M. Aurelius, born at Lanuvium on 31 August 161, and died in 165. His name often appears in the form Fulvius, as here.
